question: Norwegian... Jans Bolen.
answer: Gotta be from the Norwegian camp.

question: How far's that?
answer: 'Bout eighty kilos southwest.

question: How do you know? ...Guys as crazy as that could have done a lot of damage to their own before they got to us.
answer: Nothing we can do about that.

question: Yes, there is. I'd like to go up.
answer: In this weather?

question: Anyway, he's probably ripped.
answer: Poor little son of a bitch. You're starting to lose it, aren't you? ...Cheating bastard...

question: You jerking off or just pissed?
answer: We got any more of those electronic chess things down in supply?

question: Get your gear on.
answer: What for? ...Craziness... This is goddamn insane...

question: Anybody there?!
answer: Anybody in there?!

question: We're Americans!
answer: Come to help you!! Give me a hand. Hey, Sweden...! You okay? Sweden?!

question: My God, what in hell happened here?
answer: Come on, Copper. Hey, Sweden!!!

question: They're not Swedish, goddamn it, they're Norwegian, MacRe --
answer: Norwegian of the Month, Doc. Harmless. Holy shit...

question: Christ... ...Laboratory.
answer: Portable video unit. Anything?

question: All in Norwegian.
answer: What are you doing?

question: Could be important work. Might as well bring it back.
answer: It's getting late. Hurry it. I'm going to check the last few rooms.

question: How much more of this crap is there?
answer: About nine more hours.

question: We can't learn anything from this.
answer: Probably right. MacReady and I were listening to some of these cassettes on the way back. Like you gentlemen to hear it.

question: What's happening?
answer: Childs, you got the torch? You get your ass in here!!

question: Where are you?
answer: Torch it over there!

question: The dogs?
answer: Screw the dogs!! Torch it!!

question: That tape MacReady showed us this morning...
answer: Couldn't make much of it myself.

question: I've asked him to try and locate the site. Okay with you?
answer: Sure. You think there's a connection?

question: Magnesium of some type... or some kind of strange alloy. And those poor dumb bastards had to go and blow the hell out of it.
answer: So what do you make of it?

question: You know damn well what we both make of it.
answer: No chance it could have been some new kind of test craft?

question: So, MacReady, come on now. These Norwegian dudes come by... find him and dig him up...
answer: Yeah, they dig him up and cart him back. He gets thawed out, wakes up and scares the shit out of them. And they get into one hell of a brawl...

question: Now how's this motherfucker wake up after thousands of years in the ice, huh?
answer: I don't know how. Because he's different than we are. Because he's a space guy. What do you want from me, anyway. Go ask Blair.

question: Clark, did you notice anything strange about that dog? Just anything at all? Any little thing?
answer: No. Just that he recovered real quick... That night when I found him in the rec room, he had already scraped off his bandage. Before I put him with the others, I redressed his wound and noticed it had healed up real good...

question: That night?
answer: Yeah.

question: What was he doing in the rec room?
answer: Well, after I worked on him -- thought I'd let him rest. Left the room for a bit. When I came back, he was gone.

question: Well, where was he? Where did he go?
answer: Don't know. Looked for him for a bit... couldn't find him.

question: You're saying he wasn't put into the kennel until the night?
answer: Well... yeah.

question: How long were you with the dog? Alone, I mean?
answer: Ah... He was hurt bad. Bullet nicked an artery... I don't know... An hour... hour and a half... What the hell you looking at me like that for?

question: The hell you won't, MacReady!
answer: Don't you understand?! That Thing didn't want to become a dog...

question: Damn you, Blair! You've already got everybody half-hysterical around here.
answer: You can't let anybody leave!

question: And mainly ours. Leave a bit of an opening so he can see out. How you doin', old boy?
answer: I don't know who to trust.

question: Know what you mean, Blair. Trust is a tough thing to come by these days. Just trust in the Lord.
answer: Watch Clark.

question: What?
answer: Watch him close. Ask him why he didn't kennel the dog.

question: Stay back!!
answer: What we going to do?!

question: How the fuck do I know?! Torch them!!
answer: But...

question: Hey, Sanchez!
answer: in terror, runs at top speed through the narrow corridors. as he reaches a small armory. A glass case set into the wall. A half dozen rarely used guns are inside. He tries the handle. Locked.

question: Put that down!
answer: No.

question: I'll put this right through your head.
answer: You guys going to let him give orders? I mean he could be one of those Things.

question: I got your goodies, superdude. What you doin'?
answer: Nobody's getting in here. You can tell them all that!

question: Well, who the hell you think wants to get in there with you? Now why'd you go and...
answer: And I don't want any more food with sedatives in it. I know what you're up to. Don't think I don't. And if anyone tries to get in here -- I've got rope. I'll hang myself before it gets to me.

question: Be quick. Oh, no.
answer: Childs! That a fuse?

question: No. The generator. You got the auxiliary box just off the kitchen. Get to it. Where's the damn flashlight? You fellas okay over there? Cut that out, Copper. Nauls? What's taking you?!
answer: I'm working it! Nothing's happening!

question: That's impossible, man! Okay, Clark, out of the john where I can see you!
answer: It's shorted out or something!

question: What's happened?!
answer: MacReady, that you?

question: Yeah!
answer: It's the generator I think! No power.

question: Well, let's get down there.
answer: MacReady!

question: What?
answer: Garry's missing!

question: Oh, shit! Well, hang on!
answer: Gee, thanks!

question: Where'd you go? I said where? Where'd you go?!
answer: Was dark... find a light...

question: You lying bastard...
answer: I rather don't like your tone...

question: Hey, Blair!! Has Fuchs been out here?
answer: I've changed my mind... I'd... I'd like to come back inside... I don't want to stay out here any more... Funny things... I hear funny things out here.

question: Have you come across Fuchs?
answer: Fuchs...? No, it's not Fuchs... You must let me back in... I won't harm anyone... I promise...

question: We'll see...
answer: I promise! I'm much better now! I'll be good!! I'm all better!! Don't leave me here!!

question: My babies.
answer: Somebody broke in.

question: Now who'd go and do...
answer: Childs!!

question: Let go of me...
answer: Don't get near 'em. The plants! They're alive. Those things can imitate anything...

question: What's it going to do, being a plant?
answer: We got to burn 'em.

question: Damn it, he's got the keys.
answer: What are you doing?

question: You're a dead man, MacReady -- or a dead whatever the hell you are! We found your clothes -- the ones you tried to burn.
answer: What clothes?

question: You been made, MacReady.
answer: Someone's trying to mark me, you bastard... trying to frame me.

question: Quiet down... ...turn that thing on. Now hold him.
answer: I'm a real light sleeper, Childs...

question: Enough, MacReady! Again... More current this time, Sanchez...
answer: And if anyone tries to wake me...

question: Damn if I won't.
answer: You ain't tying me up.

question: Then I'll have to kill you.
answer: Then kill me.

question: I mean it.
answer: I guess you do.

question: I didn't think you'd use that fibrillator on Norris if you were one of them. Watch them. Now I'll show you what I already know.
answer: Load of bullshit.

question: We'll see. Let's try Clark.
answer: So Clark was human, huh? So that make you a murderer.

question: Little over two hours.
answer: Maybe it ain't coming.

question: Then we go after him.
answer: Bet the last place you ever go.

question: Damn it, ran out of gas. Sweetheart, it's going to get mighty cold in here soon... You better make your move... I mean, hell, I'm only one person... I know you're bugged because we ruined your trip, right? Spiffy little toy you had there. But your real hang up is your looks... Atta boy. I know you're around. Come on, sucker.
answer: Did you kill it?

question: I think so.
answer: What do you mean "you think so?"

question: Yeah. I got it. Pretty mean frostbite.
answer: It'll turn black again soon enough. Then I guess I'll be losing the whole thing... ...Think my toes are already gone. So you're the only one who made it.

question: Not the only one.
answer: The fire's got the temperature way up all over camp... won't last long though.

question: Neither will we.
answer: Maybe we should try and fix the radio... try and get some help.

question: Maybe we shouldn't.
answer: Then we'll never make it.

question: Maybe we shouldn't make it.
answer: If you're worried about anything, let's take that blood test of yours.

question: If we've got any surprises for each other -- we shouldn't be in any condition to do anything about it. You play chess?
answer: I guess I'll be learning.
